titles.title: Providing for the consideration of the bill (H.R. 665) to control crime by mandatory victim restitution.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 104-19, by Ms. Pryce.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 665 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. Bill is open to amendments. It shall be in order to consider the Judiciary Committee amendment in the nature of a substitute as the original bill for the purpose of amendment. Amendments printed in the Record prior to consideration will be given priority in recognition.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 11.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 2/6/1995--Introduced. Sets forth the open rule for the consideration of H.R. 665 (crime victim restitution).
